Job Title: Construction Project Manager

Location: Miami, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
PROJECT MANAGERNavicon is a growing passionate construction boutique firm working to build the best-in-class high-end construction services in South-east Florida. 
We are seeking for an eager Full- time Project Manager to lead the strategic and day-to-day direction of assigned residential projects from start to finish. The ideal candidate must possess the knowledge, experience and confidence to engage and professionally interact with the design professionals, consultants and client. This individual will fulfill an integral role on the project.
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members, you will have the opportunity to grow your career and contribute your ideas to our industry, raising the bar, while having fun! We are a Miami based company and serve Miami-Dade, Broward and Palm-Beach County.
RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Construction management and administration (managing RFI’s, Submittals, CO’s, etc.);Review of drawings for completeness and best practices.Review and assess consulting scheduling and agreements (construction, design);Responsible for purchase orders, budget adherence, and all project-related costsNegotiate contracts with external vendors to reach profitable agreements.Manage and analyze direct and indirect cost budget.Creates, maintain and coordinate project schedules.Manage single or multiple projects at various stages of development.Delegate and oversee responsibilities to team members of assigned projects.Coordinate, manage and negotiate with different municipalities all permits requirements and grant approvals. Conduct periodic site visits to monitor construction, review contractors' requisitions for payment and recommend the release of construction funds.Observe general compliance of as-built conditions with the contract drawings and specifications.Review construction schedules, trade payment breakdowns, job cost reports, and payment requisitions.Approve and send out weekly project status reports and direct daily client communication.Coordinate subcontractor work in all trades associated with that project(s).Establish and communicate deadlines for project completion.Able to manage, teach and train junior staff in all areas of Project ManagementPrepare construction budgets for review and approval by upper Management
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related fields.At least 3+ years of experience in construction administration, architecture, engineering, construction management or similar experience.Detail oriented, strong aptitude in computer skills, communication skills and grammatical skillsKnowledge of the local permitting process and construction delivery methods and Agreements.Familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes.Proficiency in Word, Excel, and Outlook and MS ProjectMust be fluent in Spanish and English (Required)Initiative / Self- MotivationExcellent written and verbal communication skills.
Benefits:Health insurance*Dental insurance*Vision insurance*401(k) matching*Performance BonusCar Allowance3 weeks paid individual vacation, including 1 week of group leave vacation6 paid personal days6 paid Federal Holidays6 paid days for leave of absence because of illnessPaid Toll + Gas expenses during working hoursComplementary large selection of office snacks.Paid maternity/paternity/adoption leave of absencePaid childbirth leavePaid parking.
*Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleTerms of insurances policies apply
Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Navicon leaders:Has high standardsGood interpersonal skills.Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical executionExpects and requires innovation of their teamThinks big and has convictionsIs action and results-orientedIs analytical and structuredHas the innate ability to inspire passion in others.
Language:English (Required)Spanish (Required)
 Work authorization:United States (Required)

Experience Level (if available): None
